sen.j: 城陽駅（じょうようえき）は、京都府城陽市大字寺田林ノ口7番地にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located at 7 Hayashinokuchi Oaza-Terada, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, Joyo Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Joyo Station, located at 7 Hayashinokuchi Oaza-Terada, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Joyo Station, located at 7 Hayashinokuchi Oaza-Terada, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: 色々なJRのウェブサイトを見たところ、JR-West, JR Westとハイフンがあったりなかったりと統一されていないようです。JR西日本のウェブサイトではハイフン有りでの記載が多いようですが、それでもハイフンなしもありました。既出ファイルでJR Westとハイフンなしで訳されてきているため、ここでもハイフンなしで記載しています。

sen.j: かつては1面1線、片面プラットホームのみの小さな駅であったが、1991年5月に、相対式2面2線のホームを持つ、立派な橋上駅に生まれ変わっている。
sen.e: Once a small station with a single platform and track on one side only, reborn a fine over-track station in May 1991spanning two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
Once a small station with a single platform and track on one side only, it was reborn as a fine over-track station in May 1991spanning two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
Once a small station with a single platform and track on one side only, it was reborn as a fine over-track station in May 1991, spanning two platforms opposite each other and two tracks in between.

sen.j: なお駅業務は（株）ジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅であり、ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: Both ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used at this station as well PiTaPa Cards (Surutto Kansai Association) subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cards.
The ICOCA and J Through cards can be used at this station as well PiTaPa cards (Surutto Kansai Association), subject to their mutual use with ICOCA cards.
The ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used at this station as well PiTaPa cards (Surutto KANSAI Association), subject to their mutual use with ICOCA cards.
sen.cmt: J-Thru Surutto KANSAI としました。

sen.j: この駅は運行上の境界駅になっており、日中は毎時4本ある普通電車の内の2本が折り返す。
sen.e: This station is an operational boundary station and two out of four local trains every hour turn back at this station for shuttle operations during the daytime.
This station is an operational boundary station, and two out of four local trains every hour turn back at this station for shuttle operations during the daytime.
This station is an operational boundary station, and two out of four local trains every hour turn back at this station for shuttle operations during the daytime.

sen.j: 折り返し電車は、JRとしては珍しく引上線を使うために西側のホームは京都方面、東側のホームは当駅止め・奈良方面（一部京都方面行きの列車がある）と完全に分けられている。
sen.e: As trains for shuttle operations use the draw-out track which is rather uncommon for JR, the westerly platform is used for Kyoto bound and the easterly platform either for trains terminating at this station or bound for Nara (some trains for Kyoto,) a completely segregated arrangement.

Because trains for shuttle operations use the draw-out track, which is not very common for JR, the westerly platform is used for Kyoto bound trains and the easterly platform is used either for trains terminating at this station or those bound for Nara (some trains for Kyoto), thus representing a completely segregated arrangement.

Because trains for shuttle operations use the draw-out track, which is not very common for JR, the westerly platform is used for Kyoto bound trains and the easterly platform is used either for trains terminating at this station or those bound for Nara (some trains for Kyoto), thus representing a completely segregated arrangement.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約 3,266人である。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station was approximately 3,266 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: “約”ではなく“平均”ではないでしょうか？さもなければ1の単位までは？訳は"約"のままです。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station amounted to approximately 3,266 per day in fiscal 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 3,266 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: 京都府立城陽高等学校
寺田駅 (京都府)（近鉄京都線）......西へ徒歩15分ほど。
sen.e: Terada Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kintetsu Kyoto Line)……some 10min. walk to the west.
Terada Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kintetsu Kyoto Line)……about a 10-minute walk to the west.
Terada Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kintetsu Kyoto Line): About a 15-minute walk to the west.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: JR Westとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）5月21日 相対式2面2線ホームの橋上駅舎に改築。
sen.e: Renovated and reopened on May 21, 1991as an over-track station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks.
The renovated facility was reopened on May 21, 1991 as an over-track station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks.
May 21, 1991: The renovated facility was reopened as an over-track station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）
宇治駅 (JR西日本) - 城陽駅 - 玉水駅
sen.e: Uji Station (JR-West) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station
Uji Station (JR-West) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station
Uji Station (JR West) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station

sen.j: 新田駅 (京都府) - 城陽駅 - 玉水駅
sen.e: Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station
Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station
Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Joyo Station - Tamamizu Station

sen.cmt: 大文字に修正・を/に変更しました。

sen.j: 新田駅 - 城陽駅 - 長池駅
sen.e: Shinden Station - Joyo Station - Nagaike Station
Shinden Station - Joyo Station - Nagaike Station
Shinden Station - Joyo Station - Nagaike Station
